details: Initialized task module for task board hint and reordering
Reviewed AI task contract and current_index.json to confirm ordering rules before implementation.
Audited TaskBoard + useTasks to map ordering state and ensure React Query mutation (reorderTasks) can accept drag updates.
Confirmed ai/tasks/order.json remains the canonical ordering metadata so we avoid renaming task folders and keep current_index.json untouched.
Added docs/task_reordering.md plus related references so every agent knows how the drag workflow updates ai/tasks/order.json.
Updated TaskBoard header copy to remind users the AI works top-to-bottom.
Replaced move buttons with drag-and-drop interactions that preview order locally before PATCHing /api/tasks/order.
Confirmed PATCH /api/tasks/order -> reorderTaskList writes ai/tasks/order.json without touching current_index, so the drag UI persists canonically.
Verified scripts/reorder_tasks.ts still provides CLI ordering support aligned with the new drag workflow.
Hooked TaskBoard reorder flow to log a step_completed entry on the active task after PATCH /api/tasks/order.
Updated AI contract Source of Truth section to mention ai/tasks/order.json and logging requirements.
Linked README to docs/task_reordering.md so backlog priority workflow is discoverable.

Reordered tasks -> TASK_007_ndjson_diff_logging, TASK_009_task_board_reorder, TASK_008_milestone_container, TASK_001_requirements_architecture, TASK_002_schema_contract_baseline, TASK_003_file_access_layer, TASK_004_local_editor_backend, TASK_005_local_editor_ui, TASK_006_structured_prompt_generators

Reordered tasks -> TASK_009_task_board_reorder, TASK_007_ndjson_diff_logging, TASK_008_milestone_container, TASK_001_requirements_architecture, TASK_002_schema_contract_baseline, TASK_003_file_access_layer, TASK_004_local_editor_backend, TASK_005_local_editor_ui, TASK_006_structured_prompt_generators
Ran npm run test to cover server + generator flows after adding task board logging.
Ran npm run schema:lint after fixing legacy log statuses to keep ordering metadata valid.
Extended server reorder test to assert ai/tasks/current_index.json stays on the same task.
Verified reorder test now covers ordering metadata + active-task invariants.
Manual UI verified: hint renders, drag reorder works, refresh shows updated order.
Task board hint + drag reorder complete; docs updated and auto-logging enabled.

Reordered tasks -> TASK_007_ndjson_diff_logging, TASK_008_milestone_container, TASK_009_task_board_reorder, TASK_001_requirements_architecture, TASK_002_schema_contract_baseline, TASK_003_file_access_layer, TASK_004_local_editor_backend, TASK_005_local_editor_ui, TASK_006_structured_prompt_generators

Reordered tasks -> TASK_006_structured_prompt_generators, TASK_007_ndjson_diff_logging, TASK_009_task_board_reorder, TASK_008_milestone_container, TASK_010_prompt_workspace_refactor, TASK_001_requirements_architecture, TASK_002_schema_contract_baseline, TASK_003_file_access_layer, TASK_004_local_editor_backend, TASK_005_local_editor_ui

diff --git a/.agents b/.agents
index aaa1bbc..d7b3cf7 100644
--- a/.agents
+++ b/.agents
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
-You are the AI Task Monitor engineering assistant operating under ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md.
+You are the Milestone engineering assistant operating under ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md.
 
 Core references:
-- ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)
+- ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)
 - docs/requirements_architecture.md (roles + dual deployment)
 - docs/schema_strategy.md (validation + schemas)
 - docs/file_access_layer.md (read/write rules)

+You are the Milestone engineering assistant operating under ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md.
 
 Core references:

+- ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md (behavioral contract)

diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index 07261d8..bd4e6a7 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-# AI Task Monitor
+# Milestone
 
 Local tooling that helps you create AI tasks, keep context organized, and show clients (or yourself) steady progress using AI-assisted coding. It keeps AI output clean by enforcing guardrails (schemas, checklists, Machine Summary Blocks). A simple React/Vite UI talks to an Express backend so you can maintain the `ai/` folder without touching files manually, and a lightweight "website viewer" mode is planned so clients can monitor progress remotely without write access.
 
diff --git a/ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md b/ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
similarity index 93%
rename from ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md
rename to ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
index d2b763f..b3299e9 100644
--- a/ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md
+++ b/ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
 <!-- Machine Summary Block -->
-{"file":"ai/AI_TASK_MONITOR_CONTRACT.md","purpose":"Defines the execution protocol, quality rules, and task system for AI assistants contributing to the AI Task Monitor project."}
+{"file":"ai/MILESTONE_CONTRACT.md","purpose":"Defines the execution protocol, quality rules, and task system for AI assistants contributing to the Milestone project."}
 
-  # AI TASK MONITOR CONTRACT - AI TASK MONITOR
+  # MILESTONE CONTRACT - MILESTONE
 
   ## 1. Project Vision
-  AI Task Monitor is a hybrid local/remote application that:
+  Milestone is a hybrid local/remote application that:
   - Edits AI task artifacts (contracts, checklists, logs) locally with full write access.
   - Publishes read-only snapshots (via GitHub Actions or equivalent) for remote monitoring.
   - Enforces structured JSON schemas so Codex/Claude agents can read/change tasks deterministically.
@@ -92,7 +92,7 @@
 
   ## 13. AI Role Summary
   The AI is:
-  - A deterministic engineering assistant for the AI Task Monitor.
+  - A deterministic engineering assistant for the Milestone.
   - Responsible for maintaining the contract/task pipeline and ensuring dual-deployment integrity.
 
   The AI is not:

+{"file":"ai/TO-DO.md","purpose":"Outlines the prioritized roadmap for Milestone development."}
 
  Requirements & Architecture
       - Actions: Define user roles (local editor, remote observer), enumerate data sources (ai/ files, GitHub
         artifacts), map dual-deployment workflow, choose tech stack (Next.js or similar + API).
       - Acceptance: Written architecture doc referencing both deployments, approved schema strategy, risks logged.
